---
title: setDebug()
description: Enable debugging on your site through the browser console.
exl-id: c042d521-46b4-441b-a91f-685e0428e4dd
---
# `setDebug()`

The `_satellite.setDebug()` method allows you to enable or disable [Debugging](../use-cases/debugging.md) on your site. This method is intended to run locally in your browser console; Adobe advises against calling this method within tag rules.

```ts
_satellite.setDebug(enabled: boolean): void
```

* **`_satellite.setDebug(true);`**: Enables [Debugging](../use-cases/debugging.md). Messages generated by the tag library (including [`_satellite.logger`](logger.md)) are visible in your browser console.
* **`_satellite.setDebug(false);`**: Disables debugging. Console messages generated by the tag library are not visible.

```js
// This console message does not appear because debug mode is not yet enabled
_satellite.logger.log('Example message');

// Enable debug mode
_satellite.setDebug(true);

// This console message appears in the console
_satellite.logger.info('Debug messages are now visible');

// Disable debug mode
_satellite.setDebug(false);

// This console message does not appear because debug mode is no longer enabled
_satellite.logger.warn('Incorrect rule trigger detected');
```

>[!NOTE]
>
>Messages written with JavaScript's native `console.log()` are always visible to anyone with DevTools open. Adobe recommends using [`_satellite.logger`](logger.md) where possible.

## Debug mode persistence

When calling this method, debug mode uses the following scope:

* **Browser session**: debug mode persists across page loads. It remains enabled until you end the browser session or explicitly disable it.
* **Origin-scoped**: debug mode persists only for the same site (domain + port + protocol).
* **Per browser profile**: debug mode is not cross-profile.

Other forms of [Debugging](../use-cases/debugging.md) can impact and overwrite debug mode using the browser console method.
